item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A woman, especially if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You must learn some of my philosophy. Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are people, who the more you do for them, the less they will do for themselves." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Shakespeare
Ashley add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Shakespeare
Ashley add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Brevity is the soul of wit." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Henry van Dyke
item.description: "Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not." -- Henry van Dyke

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ashley add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ashley add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ashley add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ashley add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "A faithful friend is a strong defense; And he that hath found him hath found a treasure." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "People don't have fortunes left them in that style nowadays; men have to work and women to marry for money. It's a dreadfully unjust world." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another." -- Charles Dickens
